trend_summary: Across the image set, settlement remains limited to scattered hamlets; no sizable town emerges. The most visible evolution is land-cover: forest in the north and west is progressively thinned, while rectangular pasture and crop fields spread eastward and into the central valley. Road traces sharpen slightly, but built-up footprint stays tiny and discontinuous.
notable_changes: Gradual clearing of forest on eastern slopes, replaced by patchwork fields.
Expansion of pasture/crop parcels in the central valley floor.
Minor elongation of road network linking scattered farms.
Small clusters of rooftops appear near valley junctions, yet remain low in number.
Overall vegetation vitality varies, with one image showing markedly drier, browner cover.
